maml:description.maml:para: Converts an IPv4 Address or Subnet into Windows PTR Zone compatible domain name.
Converts an IPv4 Address or Subnet into Windows PTR Zone compatible domain name.
IPv4 Address to convert to an inverse address
The subnet id to convert to an inverse address
The subnet prefix for the subnet to convert to an inverse address
IPv4 Address to convert to an inverse address
The subnet prefix for the subnet to convert to an inverse address
The subnet id to convert to an inverse address
Returns all valid IPv4 Address in a string.
Find-IPv4Address will search a block of text for IPv4 Addresses and returns only the IPv4 Addresses found.
The block of text to discover IPv4 Addresses
The block of text to discover IPv4 Addresses

maml:alert.maml:para: The body of text provided to the Text parameter can be multi-line. The function will only return valid IPv4 Addresses from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Find-IPv4Address -Text 'Mary had little lamb 192.168.1.1 who fleece was white as snow, 127.0.0.1.'
192.168.1.1 127.0.0.1

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the information regarding a subnet that an IPv4 Address exists

Returns the information regarding a subnet that an IPv4 Address exists and returns information regarding Subnet ID, Broadcast Address, Subnet Mask, Network Prefix, First IP Address, Last IP Address, Total Hosts, and AWS related information.
The IPv4 Address
This switch omits the reporting of Private Address Space for the subnet and any associated AWS information
The network prefix
The IPv4 Address
The subnet mask of the network
The IPv4 Address
This switch omits the reporting of Private Address Space for the subnet and any associated AWS information
The network prefix
The subnet mask of the network

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will only return results for AWS if the subnet has a prefix greater or equal to 16 and less than or equal 28 and resides in the Private Address Space.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-SubnetInformation -IPv4Address 192.168.1.120 -SubnetMask 255.255.254.0
SubnetId : 192.168.0.0 BroadcastAddress : 192.168.1.255 SubnetMask : 255.255.254.0 Prefix : 23 Subnet : 192.168.0.0/23 FirstIPv4Address : 192.168.0.1 LastIPv4Address : 192.168.1.254 TotalHosts : 510 AWSFirstIPv4Address : 192.168.0.4 AWSTotalHosts : 507 PrivateAddressSpace : True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-SubnetInformation -IPv4Address 8.8.0.0 -Prefix 21
SubnetId : 8.8.0.0 BroadcastAddress : 8.8.7.255 SubnetMask : 255.255.248.0 Prefix : 21 Subnet : 8.8.0.0/21 FirstIPv4Address : 8.8.0.1 LastIPv4Address : 8.8.7.254 TotalHosts : 2046 AWSFirstIPv4Address : AWSTotalHosts : PrivateAddressSpace : False

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-SubnetInformation -IPv4Address 10.0.0.0 -Prefix 12
SubnetId : 10.0.0.0 BroadcastAddress : 10.15.255.255 SubnetMask : 255.240.0.0 Prefix : 12 Subnet : 10.0.0.0/12 FirstIPv4Address : 10.0.0.1 LastIPv4Address : 10.15.255.254 TotalHosts : 1048574 AWSFirstIPv4Address : AWSTotalHosts : PrivateAddressSpace : True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-SubnetInformation -IPv4Address 10.0.0.0 -Prefix 28 -NoPrivateAddressSpace
SubnetId : 10.0.0.0 BroadcastAddress : 10.0.0.15 SubnetMask : 255.255.255.240 Prefix : 28 Subnet : 10.0.0.0/28 FirstIPv4Address : 10.0.0.1 LastIPv4Address : 10.0.0.14 TotalHosts : 14 AWSFirstIPv4Address : AWSTotalHosts : PrivateAddressSpace :

maml:description.maml:para: Returns GeoIP Information from ip-api.com.
Returns GeoIP Information from ip-api.com.
The non-RFC 1918 IPv4 Address to obtain the GeoIP information.
The non-RFC 1918 IPv4 Address to obtain the GeoIP information.

maml:alert.maml:para: Do not use this function multiple times a second or you will be rate limited.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Invoke-IPv4GeoLookup -IPv4Address 1.1.1.1
status : success country : Australia countryCode : AU region : QLD regionName : Queensland city : South Brisbane zip : 4101 lat : -27.4766 lon : 153.0166 timezone : Australia/Brisbane isp : Cloudflare, Inc org : APNIC and Cloudflare DNS Resolver project as : AS13335 Cloudflare, Inc. query : 1.1.1.1 mapReference : https://www.google.com/maps?q=-27.4766,153.0166

maml:description.maml:para: Sorts an array of IPv4 Addresses.
Sorts an array of IPv4 Addresses.
The list of IPv4 Addresses
This switch will sort the IPv4 Addresses in reverse order
This switch will sort the IPv4 Addresses in reverse order
The list of IPv4 Addresses
Outputs a list of IPv4 Addresses from a CIDR address range.
Outputs a list of IPv4 Addresses from a CIDR address range.
The subnet id of the IPv4 Address range
The Prefix of the IPv4 Address range
The subnet id of the IPv4 Address range
The Subnet Mask of the IPv4 Address range
The Prefix of the IPv4 Address range
The subnet id of the IPv4 Address range
The Subnet Mask of the IPv4 Address range

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will output usable IP space.

maml:description.maml:para: Breaks up a larger CIDR into small CIDRs.
Breaks up a larger CIDR into small CIDRs.
The Subnet Id to split
The network prefix of the source CIDR
The network prefix to split the subnet into
The network prefix of the source CIDR
The Subnet Id to split
The network prefix to split the subnet into

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Split-Subnet -Subnet 10.2.2.0 -Prefix 24 -TargetPrefix 25
SubnetId : 10.2.2.0 BroadcastAddress : 10.2.2.127 SubnetMask : 255.255.255.128 Prefix : 25 Subnet : 10.2.2.0/25 FirstIPv4Address : 10.2.2.1 LastIPv4Address : 10.2.2.126 TotalHosts : 126 AWSFirstIPv4Address : 10.2.2.4 AWSTotalHosts : 123
SubnetId : 10.2.2.128 BroadcastAddress : 10.2.2.255 SubnetMask : 255.255.255.128 Prefix : 25 Subnet : 10.2.2.128/25 FirstIPv4Address : 10.2.2.129 LastIPv4Address : 10.2.2.254 TotalHosts : 126 AWSFirstIPv4Address : 10.2.2.132 AWSTotalHosts : 123

maml:description.maml:para: Evaluates if an IPv4 Address is equal or within an IPv4 Address range.
Evaluates if an IPv4 Address is equal or within an IPv4 Address range.
The first IPv4 Address
The last IPv4 Address
The IPv4 Address to test
The first IPv4 Address
The last IPv4 Address
The IPv4 Address to test
Determines if an IPv4 Address is in a private address space.
Determines if an IPv4 Address is in a private address space.
The IPv4 Address
The IPv4 Address

maml:alert.maml:para: The function supports RFC 1918 & RFC 6598 address space.
